      public double[] getMotorPowers()

    • resetEncoders

      public void resetEncoders()

    • setPowers

      public void setPowers​(double power)
      Sets powers for each motor. It uses configured motor directions and reverses the power to make it spin in the right direction
      Parameters:
      power - power for all motors

    • setPowers

      public void setPowers​(double[] powers)
      Sets powers for each motor. It uses configured motor directions and reverses the power to make it spin in the right direction
      Parameters:
      powers - powers for each individual motors

    • getMotorsIndexesForSide

      public int[] getMotorsIndexesForSide​(Motors.MotorSide side)
      Returns indexes of motors to get for that side
      Parameters:
      side -
      Returns:

    • getMotorPositions

      public int[] getMotorPositions()
      Retrieves motor encoder positions that accounts for motor directions. Follows motor index convention: First index refers to front left wheel, and goes clockwise

    • getMotorDirections

      public int[] getMotorDirections()
      Returns array for directions of motors. This is used to configure what direction motors are supposed to spin. A -1 implies reversed spin while +1 indicates as is. Configure this so that all wheels move in same direction set all the powers to some value.
      Returns:
      An array of -1 or 1's.

    • applyMotorDirections

      public double[] applyMotorDirections​(double[] motorPowers)
      Applies motor directions (reversed or not reversed) to array with motor powers.
      Parameters:
      motorPowers - array of motor powers
      Returns:
      Motor powers with motor directions applied

    • applyMotorDirections

      public int[] applyMotorDirections​(int[] motorEncoderTicks)

    • translationWeights

      public double[] translationWeights​(double angle, double powerMag)
      Returns motor power weights which allow translation across a plane for a specified angle; See https://seamonsters-2605.github.io/archive/mecanum/ for explanation of mecanum movement.
      Parameters:
      angle - Angle, specified in radians where 0 is right.
      powerMag - The power magnitude of the movement (basically speed). Between 0 and 1.

    • getNetPositionVector

      public PVector getNetPositionVector()
      This adds up the vector positions that the movement of the wheels creates. Can specify encoder positions or default uses the current encoder positions.
      Returns:
      PVector of the robot's current position since the last encoder reset by default

    • getNetPositionVector

      public PVector getNetPositionVector​(int[] encoderPositions)

    • reverseMotorsOnSide

      public double[] reverseMotorsOnSide​(double[] powers, Motors.MotorSide side)

    • motorRotationPowers

      public double[] motorRotationPowers​(double angularPower, double[] powers)
      This calculates the new motor powers to create a spin. Compensates for values > 1.
      Parameters:
      angularPower - the angular velocity to spin the robot at. Same as polar plane. + number implies counter clockwise, - clockwise.
      powers - the existing powers to apply a rotation to
      Returns:
      new motor powers
